job_title: Undergraduate Student Assistant in Columbus, OH
pros: Helpful staff especially since I was an undergraduate student. They knew my future career goals and would always work to make sure I had projects that lined up with my goals.
cons: Sometimes can be overwhelming, especially in the field I was in where we had to assess a lot of healthcare barriers.

review_title: Great learning environment and work with some of the best docs, ineffective APRN management structure
job_title: Nurse Practitioner in Columbus, OH
pros: Working alongside nationally recognized physicians creates an amazing atmosphere for learning and growth. Support from pharmacy, case management, and social work is exceptional. Some of the best nurses I've ever worked with.
cons: Nursing management controls the day to day operations of the APPs, but the APPs work most closely with the physicians. Unfortunately, management is disconnected from the needs of the APP/physician relationship and until the APPs are employed by the physician group (OSUP), there will be a high degree of dissatisfaction and turnover. Given the surplus of NPs in the Columbus area, there's no real incentive to retain.

job_title: Perioperarive Assistant in Columbus, OH
pros: Loved working with the nurses, didn’t mind the work, hours were good
cons: Co-workers called off all the time, management never did anything, no accountability

job_title: Student Nurse Associate in Columbus, OH
pros: Friendly people, Good learning opportunity for students
cons: Not enough staffing, Some trainers aren't very helpful

job_title: Patient Care Assistant in Columbus, OH
pros: The James has an atmoshpere and culture centered around team work. Fellow PCAs and nurses are always willing to help out.
cons: Sometimes as a PCA, I can have up to 9 patients at a time which can be stressful. This usually only happens if someone calls off which can be frequent during the pandemic.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Columbus, OH
pros: Great place to be employed.
cons: Parking can be a bit of a headache.

job_title: Clinical Research Assistant in Columbus, OH
pros: If you are a recent college grad this is a great place to work right out of college, not only for the experience, but for the name recognition. It will set you up for success later on. Great benefits especially if you are considering going back to school. Health Insurance is expensive but good. Nice work environment (if you like your coworkers). I cant speak for all departments but at least in mine, there is a lot of support from directors and supervisors.  Not much else to say here
cons:
1. Very Low wages, consistently below national standers for almost every position here. They do not negotiate wage for most positions so don't bother trying.
2. If you are looking for a challenge don't bet on it (especially right out of college). Clinical Research Assistants don't do anything
3. beware of know it all coworkers who have been in the same position for 5 years and pretend to know everything (3/5 times they actually don't and are just guessing or making things up)
4. Moving up (or around) is almost entirely based on who you know not what you know. So be prepared to do a little butt kissing and networking. 
5. In some positions (like mine) there is no moving up (no such position exists) so you literally feel stuck and compelled to apply outside of the university if you want a new challenge. 
6. Hiring process is soooo slow.

job_title: Program Coordinator in Columbus, OH
pros: Great team members to work with, supervisors will take the time to train you
cons: Can keep you very busy

review_title: Patient Care Associate in Grad School
job_title: Patient Care Assistant in Columbus, OH
pros: The tuition benefit is the main pro! I am in graduate school full time as well and this job pays for me to attend graduate school as long as I am able to maintain full time employment at the hospital. My tuition statement was $13,500 for the fall semester until my employee benefit kicked in, then it was $1,100 TOTAL. So that's a the main perk. I also like the people I work with, however I think I got lucky there! The flexibility of hours for evenings and weekends is a pro for if you're in school and need to be able to work random hours.
cons:
The pay is SO bad for PCAs. Granted, it doesn't require a college degree to be a PCA. However, even if you do have a bachelor's degree, you still start at the bottom of the pay scale ($12/hr). The only thing that can move you up the pay scale is previous direct patient care experience, however I had 3 years and my pay only went up to $12.48! 
Also, required weekends and holidays if you work inpatient.

job_title: Staff Nurse B in Columbus, OH
pros: The potential for higher education, promotion, mobility to different jobs within the system. Numerous employee support programs.  Employee input into policy and procedure.  Nursing union to   promote fair practices.
cons: Management. Staff to patient ratio was high for the acuity level of the patients. The potential to be mandated several days in a row to obtain adequate staffing levels.  More autonomy would be a benefit. Parking was a daily issue.

job_title: Hospital Pharmacist in Columbus, OH
pros: Forward thinking institution that allows pharmacists to practice at the top of their license.
cons: Pharmacy management hinders leadership within the department. You feel undervalued and replaceable with a new graduate if you do not agree with management style. I was told to "care less" about patient care in order to fulfill other job expectations.  Ultimately I had to leave because I was compromising between my integrity/patient safety and what management wanted.

job_title: Nurse Practitioner in Columbus, OH
pros: Great benefits, I've learned a lot...
cons: Poor work/life balance. Requires more than 40 hours a week to complete required tasks. No bonuses or overtime. Only a 2% raise each year. The management has not budgeted enough money in any department for aproppriate staffing. Therefore, there is not enough support staff to help accomplish tasks in an efficient manner.

job_title: Grants Manager in Columbus, OH
pros: Become part of the culture that makes OSU so special by being an employee at OSU, you get to enjoy all the benefits as the students as well.  Free education, job security and amazing benefits
cons: Pay is less than private sector but benefits easily make up for it
